property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: A Pakistani officer presents a gift to a U.S. service member

note.text: A gift exchange might be built into some formal meeting agendas. For informal initial meetings, it's not necessary to bring a gift for your counterpart. However, it's a good idea to come prepared with a small token of esteem, just in case. Service members have found that U.S. military challenge coins are highly appreciated by Pakistani counterparts.
As your relationship progresses and you learn about your counterpart, small gifts or items they've mentioned will be appreciated, especially food items, chocolate, or souvenirs from the U.S.
